intro: Acanthosonchus, commonly known as the sandmat, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Amaranthaceae. These plants are typically found in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in sandy or gravelly soils. They are characterized by their erect, branched stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. The leaves are often narrow and hairy, adapted to reduce water loss in dry environments. Acanthosonchus species are generally herbaceous, with some varieties being perennial and others annual.
